required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: The Influence of Combined Oral Contraception on the DEvelopment and progRession of Chronic venoUs diSeases
clinical_study.official_title: The Influence of Combined Oral Contraception on the DEvelopment and progRession of Chronic venoUs diSeases

lead_sponsor.agency: Clinic of Phlebology and Laser Surgery, Chelyabinsk, Russia

clinical_study.source: Clinic of Phlebology and Laser Surgery, Chelyabinsk, Russia

brief_summary.textblock: Investigation of the influence of combined oral contraception on the development and progression of chronic venous diseases

primary_outcome.measure: Development and progression of chronic venous diseases

arm_group.description: Tableted hormonal drugs for contraception, 1) COCs with bioidentical estrogen; 2) COCs with ethinyl estradiol 30mkg according to the scheme 21 + 7; 3) COCs with ethinyl estradiol 20mkg according to the scheme 21 + 7.

intervention.description: The investigators consistently include patients who have been prescribed hormonal tablets for contraception, namely 1) COCs with bioidentical estrogen; 2) COCs with ethinyl estradiol 30mkg according to the scheme 21 + 7; 3) COCs with ethinyl estradiol 20mkg according to the scheme 21 + 7.

responsible_party.investigator_affiliation: Clinic of Phlebology and Laser Surgery, Chelyabinsk, Russia
responsible_party.investigator_title: Clinic of Phlebology and Laser Surgery
